content:
Yes, Disney has responded to criticism for its changes to the Star Wars franchise. One of the most notable criticisms came after the release of "The Last Jedi," which received mixed reviews from fans and critics. Many fans were disappointed with the direction the movie took, especially regarding the treatment of certain characters and plot points.

In response to this feedback, Disney has taken steps to address fans' concerns. For example, they have hired new writers and directors for future Star Wars movies and have made more of an effort to listen to fan feedback. Additionally, they have launched new initiatives to expand the Star Wars Universe beyond the films, including TV shows like "The Mandalorian" and "The Bad Batch."

Overall, while some fans have been critical of Disney's handling of the Star Wars franchise, the company has shown a willingness to adapt and respond to feedback from fans.
